lines.text: It's a bird. It's a plane. It's...
[chuckles]
Ralph Hinkley.
You're about as religious as a Las Vegas nightclub owner.
They give... and office like THIS to a kid... a GIRL? Come on now, counselor. I wasn't born yesterday.
No, it was more like 1880, wasn't it, Bill?
That's very funny.
I am disgusted with the both of you.
Why?
About what?
I don't know yet.
Pamela I love you very much and... I would like us to be a real team.

[cries]
Ralph, are you asking me to marry you?
Yes I am.

[cries, then nods happily]
Yes.
[about a woman who said she saw a sea monster]
She probably thought she saw what she said she thought she saw.
Freeze! F.B.I.! You're busted, fella!
You get to be vice principal. Counselor... she's a junior partner. Yours truly, Dumbo Maxwell's chuggin' across the finish line... folks up in the gallery yellin' down "Go, geezer! Go!"
Who are you?
The tooth fairy.
[punch]
This stinks. I hate this.
She may be your girlfriend but she's my counselor and nobody messes with her. That's it.
How about SCENARIO, Bill?
I wouldn't use that phone, Bill. The hospital may want you for a lobotomy.

You can't go because... WE'RE THE PACKAGE, BILL! Those little green guys they... they didn't pick us out by accident! We're supposed to do this as long as it takes. How many times have you told that to me?
Pick your friends carefully huh? Alright, so maybe I'll pick a friend.
Who ya gonna pick, Tony?
I'll pick you.
Hey, Tony, thank you. Thank you. I accept.
OK, let's not panic.
I feel like panicking. I can panic if I want to panic.
You go in there and you know what's going to happen? You're going to be sent away for so long, when you get out this suit's going to actually be in style.
C'mon... You'll do it for Bill. Old Uncle Bill. Old Uncle Wild Bill. Who loves ya, baby? Eh?
You're over-doing it "Uncle Bill"
And so we went to NewFOUNDland to make friends with all the whales and a bunch of little fishies
Bill, I've got an idea
Good, put it to me in a letter, I'll try to get back to you by the end of the month
You see what I mean? Like right now for instance. You're not even listening to me. I mean, for all I know, we could be driving into the biggest shootout of this century

[not listening]
Yeah, kid. I'll work on that for ya
Bill, are you OK? What's wrong with your knees?
Fear. Or... I'm drunk.
No, you're not drunk.
Then I'm alive!
[laughs nervously]
Thank you, Ralph. Thanks very much!
